snippet: The government said the former Assembly speaker’s sentence should be “greater than any sentence imposed on other New York State legislators convicted of public corruption offenses.”
abstract: Former State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, in emotional letter, apologizes to Federal Court judge who will hand down sentence in his corruption case in May for failing to fulfill his obligations to serve people of New York; papers filed by federal prosecutors indicate they will seek sentence of more than 14 years.
lead_paragraph: The government said the former Assembly speaker’s sentence should be “greater than any sentence imposed on other New York State legislators convicted of public corruption offenses.”

headline.main: Sheldon Silver Apologizes as Prosecutors Seek a Sentence of More Than 14 Years
headline.print_headline: Silver Apologizes as Prosecutors Seek a Sentence of More Than 14 Years
